titleStmt.title: Letter to H. Norton Shaw
Letter to H. Norton Shaw, 25 March [1857]
titleStmt.author: Livingstone, David, 1813-1873

publicationStmt.publisher: Wellcome Centre for the History of Medicine, UCL

sourceDesc.bibl: Royal Geographical Society (Great Britain); Archives, DL 2/15/4

div.p:
A few days
ago Mr Prout wrote
to me saying that
he thought I had
known that the
Directors of the Society
had placed £200
to my credit but
finding I did not
he now told me of it
I suppose your
movement has
elicited this. I had
on my arrival £100
out of my four
year's salary. Mrs
L having been obliged
to draw on it as all
she got after paying
for the children was
£45 per annum
which in war times
was not very fattening
that £100 finished
and not a word said
about aught else except
commencing a new
year (1857) which I don't
intend to do. I was
obliged to apply first
to you then to Murray
I get what I need
there - though it is eating my book
before it is
made. I don't mean
to draw any of the
£200 or anything else
as that will be
considered a hold upon
me. And I don't think
they have it in their
power to give me any
on the course I mean
to pursue. The Society
is to send the gospel
& nothing else.

When on my way
home I asked
Tidman to send me
the address of the
authorities of the
P & O. company
as I believed they
would give me
a free passage
on account of
my connection
with the R.G.S.
Instead of giving
me what I asked
Prout wrote to
some of the company
I don't know
whom and got
a promise of
the Passage money
back £105 which
I paid at the Pont
de Galle, Ceylon.
No more was said
or done untilluntil a
few days ago when
Prout in his note
said Tell me to
whom you paid
the money and
we will get it
back for you.
Now I don't quite
like this we will.
It will be returned
not on his account
at all. Are you
acquainted with
the P.& O. company?
This letting me alone
looks like wishing
to let me feel the
screw of want &
then come humbly
to them which
though I am as
much a missionary
as ever I don't
like to do.

I think you had
better not do any
more about the
Fund. Though it
would be well to
have it when I
need it & not when
on the sea or where
no shops are to be
had to spend it.

I don't mean to
draw any more
from the L.M.S.
